destinations.name: Yosemite National Park
destinations.description: A stunning natural wonder featuring granite cliffs, waterfalls, giant sequoias, and rich biodiversity. Fun fact: Half Dome is one of the park's most iconic landmarks.

destinations.name: Statue of Liberty
destinations.description: An enduring symbol of freedom and democracy gifted by France in 1886. Fun fact: The statue's full name is 'Liberty Enlightening the World.'

destinations.name: Walt Disney World
destinations.description: A magical theme park home to Cinderella's Castle and attracting millions yearly. Fun fact: It spans 43 square miles, making it larger than San Francisco.

destinations.name: The Alamo
destinations.description: A historic mission and fortress known for the pivotal 1836 battle for Texan independence. Fun fact: The Alamo originally served as a Spanish mission.

destinations.name: Waikiki Beach
destinations.description: A world-famous beach known for surfing, vibrant nightlife, and scenic ocean views. Fun fact: Waikiki means 'spouting waters' in Hawaiian.

destinations.name: Las Vegas Strip
destinations.description: A dazzling stretch of resorts, casinos, and entertainment in Las Vegas. Fun fact: The strip is 4.2 miles long and hosts over 40 million visitors yearly.

destinations.name: Rocky Mountain National Park
destinations.description: A haven for hiking, wildlife, and alpine lakes. Fun fact: It boasts over 355 miles of hiking trails and stunning mountain vistas.

destinations.name: Grand Canyon
destinations.description: One of the Seven Natural Wonders of the World, known for its breathtaking views and geological history. Fun fact: The canyon reveals nearly 2 billion years of Earth's history.

destinations.name: Denali National Park
destinations.description: A pristine wilderness home to North America's tallest peak, Denali. Fun fact: Denali's peak reaches 20,310 feet, making it the highest mountain in North America.

destinations.name: Mount Rainier National Park
destinations.description: An iconic peak and a paradise for outdoor enthusiasts with lush meadows and glaciers. Fun fact: Mount Rainier is considered one of the most dangerous volcanoes in the world due to its size and proximity to urban areas.

destinations.name: Savannah Historic District
destinations.description: A charming district with cobblestone streets, historic homes, and southern hospitality. Fun fact: Savannah is one of the oldest planned cities in the United States.

destinations.name: Crater Lake National Park
destinations.description: A deep blue lake formed in a volcanic crater, offering spectacular views and hiking trails. Fun fact: Crater Lake is the deepest lake in the United States.

destinations.name: Millennium Park
destinations.description: A public park in Chicago renowned for its art installations, including the famous Cloud Gate. Fun fact: Millennium Park hosts millions of visitors annually.

destinations.name: Freedom Trail
destinations.description: A 2.5-mile path through Boston's historic sites, offering a glimpse into the American Revolution. Fun fact: The trail includes 16 historic sites.

destinations.name: Colonial Williamsburg
destinations.description: A living-history museum showcasing restored colonial buildings and reenactments. Fun fact: Colonial Williamsburg is the world's largest living history museum.
